meanings.definition: A person who renounces or rejects something, especially pleasure or comfort.
meanings.sent1: The abnegators in the monastery lived a simple life without luxuries.
meanings.sent2: The abnegators chose to give up their own desires for the well-being of others.
meanings.sent3: The abnegators at the party refused all the delicious treats and only drank water.
meanings.sent4: In a world of excess, the abnegators stood out like beacons of self-control.
meanings.sent5: The abnegators' dedication to self-denial was truly admirable.

meanings.definition: Those who deny themselves or give up something for a greater cause.
meanings.sent1: The abnegators sacrificed their own needs to help those in need.
meanings.sent2: The abnegators put the community's well-being above their personal desires.
meanings.sent3: The abnegators decided to skip the movie night to donate to charity instead.
meanings.sent4: Like silent heroes, the abnegators worked behind the scenes for the greater good.
meanings.sent5: The abnegators' selflessness inspired others to follow their example.
